Describe clusters

as_cluster_desc.Rd

Describe clusters

as_cluster_desc(
  x,
  return = c("cluster", "super_cluster"),
  super_cluster_details = FALSE
)

Arguments

x

Vector of numeric values ranging from 0 to 21

Value

Labelled "factor"

Examples

x <- 0:21
as_cluster_desc(x)

#>  [1] Care Cluster 0: Variance                                                                
#>  [2] Care Cluster 1: Common mental health problems (Low severity)                            
#>  [3] Care Cluster 2: Common mental health problems (Low severity with greater need)          
#>  [4] Care Cluster 3: Non-psychotic (Moderate severity)                                       
#>  [5] Care Cluster 4: Non-psychotic (Severe)                                                  
#>  [6] Care Cluster 5: Non-psychotic disorders (Very severe)                                   
#>  [7] Care Cluster 6: Non-psychotic disorder of over-valued ideas                             
#>  [8] Care Cluster 7: Enduring non-psychotic disorders (High disability)                      
#>  [9] Care Cluster 8: Non-psychotic chaotic and challenging disorders                         
#> [10] Care Cluster 9: Blank cluster                                                           
#> [11] Care Cluster 10: First episode psychosis (With / without manic features)                
#> [12] Care Cluster 11: Ongoing recurrent psychosis (Low symptoms)                             
#> [13] Care Cluster 12: Ongoing or recurrent psychosis (High disability)                       
#> [14] Care Cluster 13: Ongoing or recurrent psychosis (High symptom and disability)           
#> [15] Care Cluster 14: Psychotic crisis                                                       
#> [16] Care Cluster 15: Severe psychotic depression                                            
#> [17] Care Cluster 16: Psychosis and affective disorder (High substance misuse and engagement)
#> [18] Care Cluster 17: Psychosis and affective disorder – difficult to engage                 
#> [19] Care Cluster 18: Cognitive impairment (Low need)                                        
#> [20] Care Cluster 19: Cognitive impairment or dementia complicated (Moderate need)           
#> [21] Care Cluster 20: Cognitive impairment or dementia complicated (High need)               
#> [22] Care Cluster 21: Cognitive impairment or dementia (High physical or engagement)         
#> 22 Levels: Care Cluster 0: Variance ...
as_cluster_desc(x, return = "super_cluster")

#>  [1] <NA>            A: Non-psycotic A: Non-psycotic A: Non-psycotic
#>  [5] A: Non-psycotic A: Non-psycotic A: Non-psycotic A: Non-psycotic
#>  [9] A: Non-psycotic A: Non-psycotic B: Psychosis    B: Psychosis   
#> [13] B: Psychosis    B: Psychosis    B: Psychosis    B: Psychosis   
#> [17] B: Psychosis    B: Psychosis    C: Organic      C: Organic     
#> [21] C: Organic      C: Organic     
#> Levels: A: Non-psycotic B: Psychosis C: Organic
as_cluster_desc(x, return = "super_cluster", super_cluster_details = TRUE)

#>  [1] <NA>                                       
#>  [2] A: Non-psycotic (Very severe and complex   
#>  [3] A: Non-psycotic (Very severe and complex   
#>  [4] A: Non-psycotic (Very severe and complex   
#>  [5] A: Non-psycotic (Very severe and complex   
#>  [6] A: Non-psycotic (Mild, moderate, or severe)
#>  [7] A: Non-psycotic (Mild, moderate, or severe)
#>  [8] A: Non-psycotic (Mild, moderate, or severe)
#>  [9] A: Non-psycotic (Mild, moderate, or severe)
#> [10] A: Non-psycotic (Blank place marker)       
#> [11] B: Psychosis (First episode)               
#> [12] B: Psychosis (Ongoing or recurrent)        
#> [13] B: Psychosis (Ongoing or recurrent)        
#> [14] B: Psychosis (Ongoing or recurrent)        
#> [15] B: Psychosis (Psychotic crisis)            
#> [16] B: Psychosis (Psychotic crisis)            
#> [17] B: Psychosis (Very severe engagement)      
#> [18] B: Psychosis (Very severe engagement)      
#> [19] C: Organic (Cognitive impairment)          
#> [20] C: Organic (Cognitive impairment)          
#> [21] C: Organic (Cognitive impairment)          
#> [22] C: Organic (Cognitive impairment)          
#> 8 Levels: A: Non-psycotic (Blank place marker) ...
